image.altText: A man wearing a tie, holding his wife's hand as he walks away from the courthouse.

props.synopsis: Witnesses are continuing to give evidence at celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright's Northern Territory Supreme Court trial.

title.children: Matt Wright 'irate' after colleague collected pilot's diary, jury hears

image.altText: Royal Darwin Hospital Intensive Care Unit

props.synopsis: The controversial Acacia system will be switched on at Alice Springs and Tennant Creek hospitals on Saturday, despite lingering doubts about the project's safety.

title.children: 'Unsafe' patient record system to go live at two NT hospitals

image.altText: A selfie image of three people, with the one on the right blurred. Two men on left, one older (left) and younger (right).

props.synopsis: The trial of a man accused of killing his father after a violent fight in the backyard of a suburban Darwin home has begun in the Northern Territory Supreme Court.

title.children: Trial of man accused of killing father in backyard begins in Darwin

image.altText: Crocodile eggs in a tray with one that's pipped being held up by someone's hand.

props.synopsis: The charges, laid by the Australian Federal Police, relate to alleged illegal activity at the NT's Kakadu National Park in early 2024.

title.children: Two men involved in fatal chopper crash charged over stealing crocodile eggs

image.altText: A man stands in the sun on a green oval and smiles broadly as he holds a soccer ball.

props.synopsis: Eighteen-year-old Lesley Thompson will travel to Oslo for an international street soccer tournament that aims to challenge attitudes about homelessness.

title.children: Homeless Alice Springs man to play soccer for Australia in Norway

image.altText: A large white sign showing a coat of arms and the words "local court".

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has heard that a young mother was "crying out to police" for help in the lead-up to a horrific attempted murder-suicide in Darwin two years ago.

title.children: Woman 'crying out to police' months prior to attempted murder-suicide

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Palestine Presser

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has stopped short of labelling South Australia's toxic algal bloom a natural disaster while defending his response to the crisis. Follow live.

title.children: PM defends response to algal bloom and refuses to label it natural disaster

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Kids with mild development delays 'over serviced' by NDIS
Butler outlines plans for further reforms to cap NDIS growth
PM responds to Netanyahu's statement lashing Albanese

image.altText: A man dressed in hospital scrubs and a bandanna holds a baby which has its face blurred.

props.synopsis: Perth obstetrician Rhys Bellinge pleads guilty in court to the manslaughter of 24-year-old Elizabeth Pearce after ploughing into the car she was a passenger in earlier this year.

title.children: Doctor who had 'aggression to the world' admits killing woman in car crash

image.altText: Tradies work on the roof frame of a new home under construction.

props.synopsis: Housing will dominate discussion at the Economic Reform Roundtable this morning, with ministers, business leaders and conservationists all under pressure to solve the wicked problem of building more homes without trashing the environment.

title.children: Freeze on construction rules on cards amid warnings housing goal will fail

image.altText: Izak Rankine running with the ball, looking for a teammate to kick to in an AFL match.

props.synopsis: A scheduled Adelaide Crows coach Matthew Nicks press conference is delayed until Friday as the club remains in discussions with the AFL over the fate of Izak Rankine.

title.children: Crows delay press conference to Friday as Rankine decision drags on

image.altText: A woman and man inspect a black t-shirt on a mannequin

props.synopsis: Australian fashion brands that are stocked in the US are wearing the burden of the higher tariffs on Chinese made goods. And as uncertainty continues, some brands are walking away from the lucrative market.

title.children: The Australian business pulling out of the US as shipping in 'chaos'

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja has short blonde hair, she wears a blue blazer, standing outside in sunshine. She holds a purple report.

props.synopsis: Corporal punishment including smacking has been used as an excuse for "awful abuse" and should be outlawed, a royal commissioner says.

title.children: SA royal commission recommends a ban on smacking children

image.altText: Back of a man's head as he looks at ASX boards

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is on the rise, led by the financial sector. That's despite heavy losses for some stocks, with James Hardie slumping more than 25 per cent and CSL declining again. Follow live.

title.children: CSL shares fall for second day, James Hardie nosedives

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Lottery Corporation shares hit all-time high
Bendigo Bank flags half a billion dollar impairment
Market update for the middle of the trading day

image.altText: dozens of make shift tents on dirt land with destroyed buildings behind them.

props.synopsis: By stitching together the so-called "evacuation orders" issued by the Israel Defense Forces, it is possible to see just how much of Gaza Israel has already taken.

title.children: The maps that reveal how Gazans have almost nowhere left to go

image.altText: Signage is seen for Monash IVF in Clayton, Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The review was launched following unrelated cases of embryo mix-ups in Brisbane and Melbourne, which were reported this year

title.children: Review into Monash IVF embryo mix-ups to remain secret

image.altText: A side-on shot of an e-scooter on a path in a bike rack outside Bentley Plaza in Perth, with shoppers in the background.

props.synopsis: WA Police are placing e-scooters outside shopping centres for people to steal, in a "proactive" operation that one human rights advocate says is inducing disadvantaged people to commit crime.

title.children: A thief stole a scooter at a shopping centre. It was put there by police as bait

image.altText: A pile of bricks and rubbish between a fence and a shed.

props.synopsis: After relying on a buyer's agent for expert advice, a "blindsided" Sydney couple discovers their investment property has costly hidden problems.

title.children: Investors issue warning on buyer's agents after costly property blunder

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene in Charlestown.

props.synopsis: A school is in lockdown and a search underway after a man was found dead following reports of an assault in a Charlestown shopping centre car park.

title.children: Search for fleeing man after shopping centre car park death near Newcastle

image.altText: a group of pro-palestine protesters

props.synopsis: City of Melbourne councillors have voted for an amendment that will see the municipality advocate to reduce disruption caused by protests to businesses, in a proposal that will now go to community consultation.

title.children: City of Melbourne councillors vote for review of protest management

image.altText: A sign marks The Wesley Hospital.

props.synopsis: Rosemarie Campbell, who died three days after having gastric bypass surgery, was described as a dedicated grandmother during a coronial inquest into her death in Brisbane.

title.children: Patient told husband she thought surgery was 'mistake' before death

image.altText: Bernard Tomic hits a double-handed backhand shot during a tennis match, wears a green tee, black shorts and cap on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Bernard Tomic is one of six Australians to win their opening match of qualification for the US Open.

title.children: Tomic turns back clock to advance in US Open qualifiers

image.altText: A white woman with brown hair touches the side of her face as she poses for a photo

props.synopsis: Actor Aubrey Plaza speaks for the first time about the sudden death of her husband, Jeff Baena, saying her life has become a daily struggle.

title.children: 'Daily struggle': Aubrey Plaza speaks about husband's death

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a meeting table.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's allies work on plans for security guarantees for the war-torn country as the US president rules out putting American boots on the ground.

title.children: Trump rules out sending troops into Ukraine as allies consider security guarantees

image.altText: A bus in Afghanistan

props.synopsis: A passenger bus carrying migrants recently returned from Iran has collided with a truck and a motorcycle in Afghanistan's western Herat province.

title.children: At least 71 die in bus crash involving Afghans deported from Iran

image.altText: A woman sits in a dark room holding a picture of her with her husband.

props.synopsis: An Australian-first trial using psychedelic-assisted therapy for terminally ill patients is showing promising results.

title.children: How a magic mushroom compound is helping people face the terror of dying

image.altText: Man sits with bark canoe. He wears wollen jumper.

props.synopsis: Uncle Rex Greeno, who became the first Tasmanian Aboriginal man to have a solo exhibition at the Tasmanian Museum and Art Gallery last year, dies aged 83.

title.children: Respected Tasmanian elder and artist remembered as 'universally loved'

image.altText: Two brunette men in suits with light stubble on stage, one makes a speech, both have blank expressions.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Labor Party is locked in discussion over who will lead the party, with both current leader Dean Winter, from the right faction, and Josh Willie, from the left faction, keen for the role, the ABC understands.

title.children: Winter and Willie jostling for Tasmanian Labor leadership

image.altText: A woman is standing up looking at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Former childcare workers at a centre where a man is alleged to have sexually assaulted two children speak out about a culture of secrecy in the centres.

title.children: Goodstart workers 'disgusted' with childcare complaints handling in abuse case

image.altText: Year 6 girl and boy sitting in dark blue school uniform on a brown sofa

props.synopsis: One in five of the students admitted to NSW's prestigious selective schools this year came from disadvantaged groups, but ABC analysis shows that the schools one expert calls the "jewel in the crown" of NSW education remain the domain of privileged students.

title.children: The kids trying to get into NSW's 'jewel in the crown' selective schools

image.altText: A koala is sitting on rocks near a cliff's edge with water in the background

props.synopsis: The young male, found at the base of a cliff at Wategos Beach, is in hospital after ingesting seawater, rescuers say, in a sign the animals are struggling to cling to shrinking habitat.

title.children: Rescuers say Byron Bay koala plucked from rocks had fallen into sea

image.altText: Police officers gathered on a street

props.synopsis: Witnesses have told police the man was shot while getting into his car at Winston Hills in Sydney's west on Tuesday evening.

title.children: 22yo with criminal history dies after being shot in chest in Sydney's west

image.altText: Brad and Jason Moon

props.synopsis: A family in the Northern Territory have quit their day jobs to focus on growing their passionfruit business.

title.children: Tradie's foray into passionfruit growing drives thriving family business

image.altText: A deceased turtle on a rock

props.synopsis: Wildlife carers are investigating after turtles with unusual symptoms washed ashore at several popular swimming spots north of Newcastle.

title.children: Dozens of dead turtles with bleeding eyes wash up on NSW beaches

image.altText: A man looks on during a rugby league training session

props.synopsis: Ben Murdoch-Masila made his NRL debut in one of the greatest finals games ever played and went on to have a remarkable footballing life. Now, at 34 and with his career near its end, the Dragons are turning to him one last time.

title.children: Last man standing from NRL game of the century ready for one last ride

image.altText: A piece of slow-cooked lamb in a pot alongside lemon, fennel, potatoes and juices, topped with fresh green herbs.

props.synopsis: The cost of a lamb leg in the shops has nearly doubled in the past 18 months as the drought bites.

title.children: Traditional lamb roast out of reach for many families as prices double
